name: Sheraton Sofia Hotel Balkan

reviews.title: Worst hotel bed ever
reviews.text: Just one night at the Sheraton in Sofia convinced me never to go again. The beds have a plastic mattress cover which creaked and squeaked with every movement, and made sleep next to impossible. When I asked reception for a bed without the plastic, I was told they 'all have them'. This completely spoiled my trip.

I recently stayed here for one week for pleasure. The hotel not as great as it looks or sounds in the other review. I had a standard room on the 5th floor. I felt like I was staying in an old Holiday Inn. The room was dated and the bed was lumpy and very close to the floor. I asked to see several other rooms and they were all the same on the 5th floor. The bathrooms have been renovated and are very nice, but I wasn’t sleeping in the bathroom. My friends had a free room on the executive floor that was beautiful. The executive floor feels like a different hotel, but is substantially more expensive. The service in the hotel is fine, a bit blunt at times. The restaurants in the hotel are overpriced, there are better options outside of the hotel. The evening we arrived we ate in the hotel, the restaurant was empty and there was no music, only dead silence. There are probably better options for your money in the city. This did not feel like a 5 star hotel to me.
reviews.title: Didn't feel like a 5 star
Best Place in Sofia
reviews.text: I stayed here for a week last December while on business and I can only say great things about the Sheraton Balkan. First, they have a Mercedes ready for you at the airport with a no-nonsense driver who brings you straight to the door, at no charge. The hotel has retained its old world feel, with modern additions, so you feel like you're in an 18th century mansion, but standard amenities abound.
The hotel is housed in an old building in the centre of town. The lobby looks grander in the pictures, in real life it is not so elegant and a bit tacky.
reviews.title: Generally OK, room for improvement

reviews.text: Staff were reasonably friendly and helpful throughout my stay. One exception was the sullen lady who handled my check-out and was reluctant to call me a taxi from an external company, instead wanting me to use a taxi that was double the price.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: The room was nicely decorated and reasonably sized. I had requested a room to the back of the hotel, but this request was not accommodated, so I had a slightly noisier room towards the main road. The bedding was not as comfortable as I had previously experienced in Starwood hotels (e g Westin and W).
reviews.title: Old World Charm

reviews.text: I had the buffet breakfast at the restaurant and did not get charged extra for this, which was nice. The buffet had a good range and quality of food, the one thing missing however was fresh fruit.

reviews.title: Great hotel - Highly Recommend

reviews.text: I spent a weekend of downtime on a European business trip in this hotel. I was in sofia just for sightseeing. For this purpose, there are 3 hotels which are well located. this one, the Grand Hotel and the SAS Radisson. The Hilton is too far from the old cultural centre. The other hotels mentioned above are both nondescript cookie-cutter facilities, whereas the Sheraton is a converted old building with some character. The lobby is all marble and pillars, the guest floors have big wide corridors and the rooms are very comfortable and very good value for money. The staff were helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Best location for sighseeing

reviews.text: On balance, in my opinion, this hotel is the best bet for looking around Sofia on foot, with a marginally better location and more atmosphere. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends.
